title: Album Page, "Boats at Le Havre", June 5, 1887
medium: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Paper-maker's label: embossed in upper left corner: oval shield with a banner BRISTOL with a crown above and L M below.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, bottom right corner (perpendicular to drawing): 13; 14; from top to bottom of sheet: from Frascati's; Bourcoyne coming in; HAVRE / June 5 - 1887.
description: Horizontal sheet that has been cut down, but centered vertically in the binding.  Depicted are four different scenes of ships on the water.  Three scenes show boats that are in various points of the water, both near and far.  The smallest at left shows a large vessel being pulled by a tugboat.  At bottom left is a sailboat with H.20 painted twice on the starboard side of her hull.  The sails also are identified with the same lettering: 20 / (anchor symbol) / H.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Boats at Le Havre", June 5, 1887.Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-187.
